subsection_name: benh-chlamydia.json_4_Risk factors increase the likelihood of infection
subsection_content:
Factors that increase the risk of Chlamydia infection:
Having sex under 25 years old; Having sex with multiple partners; Not using condoms or other safety measures when having sex; Have a history of Chlamydia infection or other sexually transmitted diseases; Gay sex.
How common is chlamydia?
Chlamydia is a common sexually transmitted infection. The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said in 2018 that there were about 4 million cases of Chlamydia infection recorded in the country. (4)
Among them, women have a higher incidence of the disease than men, most often occurring between 15 and 24 years old. 1 in 20 sexually active young women has Chlamydia. In addition, certain demographic characteristics such as age, gender and race may affect the risk of Chlamydia.
Chlamydia causes disease in men.
